page.title: 13Darwen Town Centre
page.content: Darwen is trying to centralise all the social services available to the town. The streets used traditionally by the town have changed their roles again. The main buildings are large and help to run the town. Down the road is a health centre,a fire station,police station and Social Services Administration block. Round the corner is a youth club and a lower secondary school. At the top of the rise is the library and the theatre. Running down School street we find some empty buildings that are to be used as part of a new shopping precinct. These will join to an indoor market which has a car-park close by and an outdoor annexe to the market. The U-shape created by these streets has become a busy,well-used area.
